txt module¶

TXT output functions for FileType.TXT Manager.stream.

txt.txt_chaining(nnodes)¶

Generates a plain text table showing the binding chains between N-nodes and their associated E-nodes.

Parameters

nnodes (list[Node]) – List of N-nodes to display chains for

Return type

None

txt.txt_column_width(column)¶
Parameters

column (list[str]) –

Return type

int

txt.txt_features(nnodes)¶

Generates a plain text table displaying the feature matrix (PNF, FPF, etc.) for each node in the syntax tree.

Parameters

nnodes (list[Node]) – List of nodes to display features for

Return type

None

txt.txt_interpretations(interps)¶

Generates a plain text table displaying all valid pronoun binding interpretations found for the sentence.

Parameters

interps (list[list[list[Node]]]) – List of valid interpretations to display

Return type

None

txt.txt_lexicon()¶

Generates a plain text table displaying the feature matrix (PNF, FPF, etc.) for each entry in lexicon_dict.

Return type

None

txt.txt_nodes(nodes)¶

Generates a plain text table displaying all nodes in the syntax tree with their identifiers and properties.

Parameters

nodes (list[Node]) – List of nodes to display

Return type

None

txt.txt_row(row, widths, align)¶

  • row (list[str]) –

  • widths (list[int]) –

  • align (str) –

str

  • align (str) –

Return type

list[str]

Parameters

  • element (str) –

  • width (int) –

  • align (str) –

Return type

str

txt.txt_summary()¶

Generates a plain text table displaying demo Summary.

Return type

None

  • rows (list[list[str]]) –
